children.subject: I'd say 170 and 186 are probably most important for recruiting. I haven't taken 188 or 169A yet so I can't really comment on those, but I would probably say 188 over 169A just in terms of keeping your schedule a bit more balanced. Also, I would probably phase 1 170 and 186 since 188 usually accommodates almost everyone from what I've heard.
if you are declared getting into 170 should not be a problem in the fall

I would hold off taking CS169A if you're planning on doing an internship for the the next summer. From what I've heard, it's redundant doing an internship and taking 169A. 

If you want courses to help with recruiting, CS 170 covers important topics like big-O, divide and conquer, graphs, greedy algs, and DP in the first half of the class. It'll definitely be helpful for recruiting so definitely take that ASAP. Unlike previous semester, some people that phase 2ed CS170 were not able to get in. I'd be cautious about holding off because of the old advice that everyone gets in. 

I haven't taken the other 2 classes so I can't say anything about them. However, I think it'll be more important to brush up on Leetcode and personal projects.

169a is not needed if you have internship experience. I took 170 in a previous semester and am currently taking 186 + 188 and another upper div tech, I think 186 + 188 + 170 is a doable schedule. Idk the time commitment of UGBA 101A.

history.content: Hello everyone! I'll be a sophomore in the fall, and I am interested in taking 3 out of 4 of the courses below this fall along with Econ/UGBA 101A. The courses I'm considering are: CS 170, CS 186, CS 188 and CS 169A. My main goal for fall is to find an internship for Spring/Summer 2022 (will be my first internship), and some of my other commitments in fall may include being an uGSI (8 hour most likely). Does anyone have any recommendations on which 3 of the 4 above I should take that helps the most with recruiting? By the way, which of the 2 should I consider registering in phase 1 (assuming I'll need to phase 1 the Econ/UGBA class) and which one should I phase 2? Thanks a lot!!!
history.subject: Fall 2021 Course Planning Advice
